html: As the consequences of transgression set in and those who oppressed others are now themselves oppressed, the full weight of their misdeeds hits home. Because there was no “redress” or ‘justice” (mispat) for those whom they wronged, there now exists none for them. Because their righteousness before God was self-righteousness, righteousness—Jehovah’s servant—led away the righteous from among them (Isaiah 58:8). As even those who now repent and stand up for the truth are themselves victimized, in such an adversarial climate integrity or uprightness stands little chance of being restored.
